finalProject

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • finalProject.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Thread
    The navigator is used to change either the robot's position or heading in a controlled manner. The navigator intakes values from the odometer continuously and takes a value for either angle or position from another class and computes the difference in heading before using the difference in wheel angle count of the robot to find the amount of change needed to have the correct heading. Once the robot has the correct heading, if the robot needs to move to another position the robot calculates the amount of distance it needs to travel to reach the correct position before going there and stopping.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ian Gauthier, Ilana Haddad, Tristan Bouchard, Tyrone Wong, Alexandre Tessier

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
            double y)
        The method should move the robot to the position that is input into the method. This should call the turn to method to turn to the correct heading of the robot before finding the distance and moving that distance in a straight heading.
        Parameters:
        x - the X coordinate that should be moved to
        y - the Y coordinate that should be moved to

      • drive

        public void drive(double distance)
        The method should convert the distance into an angle in terms of the radius of the wheel and then travel forward that amount.
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance to be converted in terms of cm

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        The method should intake an angle and then turn the robot to that angle.
        Parameters:
        theta - the angle which should be turned to

      • turnToSmart

        public void turnToSmart(double angle)
        The method causes the robot to turn to an angle in relation to its current heading meaning that if 150 is input, the robot should turn 150 degrees
        Parameters:
        angle - the amount to be turned
